com.mvp4g.client.event
Class BaseEventHandler<E extends EventBus>

java.lang.Object
  com.mvp4g.client.event.BaseEventHandler<E>
Type Parameters:
E - Type of the event bus used by the event handler.
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventHandlerInterface<E>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BasePresenter
public class BaseEventHandler<E extends EventBus>
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventHandlerInterface<E>

Default implementation of EventHandlerInterface.

This implementation has an event bus attribute.
You should extend this class to create a presenter.

isActivated

public final boolean isActivated(boolean passive,
                                 java.lang.String eventName,
                                 java.lang.Object... parameters)
Description copied from interface: EventHandlerInterface
Indicates if the presenter is activated or not. If the event handler is activated and if the bind method hasn't been called yet, then the bind method should be called only if the event is active.

If the event is passive and the presenter hasn't been built, the presenter will be consider as inactive (ie isActivated will return false).

Specified by:
isActivated in interface EventHandlerInterface<E extends EventBus>
Parameters:
passive - indicate if it's a passive event or not
Returns:
true if the presenter is activated, false otherwise

pass

protected boolean pass(java.lang.String eventName,
                       java.lang.Object... parameters)
This method allows to prevent handler to handle a specific event.

Parameters:
eventName - name of the event to filter
parameters - parameters associated to the event to filter
Returns:
true if the handler can handle this event, false otherwise

setActivated

public void setActivated(boolean activated)
Description copied from interface: EventHandlerInterface
Set if the event handler is activated or not. By default, an event handler should be activated.

Specified by:
setActivated in interface EventHandlerInterface<E extends EventBus>
Parameters:
activated - new activation parameter

onBeforeEvent

public void onBeforeEvent()
Method called before each time an handler has to handle an event.

getTokenGenerator

public E getTokenGenerator()
Set the event bus in token generation mode and return it. When the event bus is in token generation mode, for the next call to an event method, it won't fire the event and forward it to handlers but instead, it will generate the event token.

Specified by:
getTokenGenerator in interface EventHandlerInterface<E extends EventBus>
Returns:
the event bus in token generation mode.
